column2: III
Well, he was here at last, dishevelled, hatless and exhausted, looking up at the dark windows.
column3: Well, he was here at last, dishevelled, hatless and exhausted, looking up at the dark windows.

column2: She babbled out a question at him.
column3: She babbled out a question at him.

column2: Oh! thank God!	Oh! thank God!
You are a priest, father?"
Yes; this was genuine enough.
When will you bring me Holy Communion?"
column3: When will you bring me Holy Communion?"

column2: He hesitated.
Tell me, are you very ill?
column3: Tell me, are you very ill?

column2: I don't know, father.	I don't know, father.
Father, ought I to tell him?"
column3: Father, ought I to tell him?"

column2: Father, I must not keep you; but tell me this--Who is this man?
column3: Father, I must not keep you; but tell me this-Who is this man?

column2: Felsenburgh?
Yes.
Her face seemed to fall away in a kind of emotion, half cunning, half fear.
column3: Her face seemed to fall away in a kind of emotion, half cunning, half fear.

column2: I am a Catholic--?"
What do you know of Felsenburgh? You have been dreaming."
column3: What do you know of Felsenburgh? You have been dreaming."

column2: You have been dreaming.	You have been dreaming.
The door is shut, father?	The door is shut, father?
Well, at least, this is what I dreamt.
column3: Well, at least, this is what I dreamt.

column2: Father---"
Very well, listen, father....	Very well, listen, father....
Nearer, father."
Hush! he said.
Who is that?
Why, her light is burning.	Why, her light is burning.
Come in, Oliver, but softly."
